{{Quote|Down in its depths glimmered like a glow-worm thread the wraith-road from the dead city to the Nameless Pass|{{TT|Stairs}}}}

'''Glow-worms''' were creatures associated with lights that glimmered in a dark environment.<ref name=stairs>{{TT|Stairs}}, p. 710</ref>

On [[10 March]] {{TA|3019}},<ref>{{App|Great}}, entry for the year 3019, March 10, p. 1093</ref> as [[Frodo Baggins]], [[Samwise Gamgee]], and [[Gollum]] climbed the [[Stairs of Cirith Ungol]] to avoid continuing on to [[Minas Morgul]], the [[Morgul-road|wraith-road]] was likened to a "glow-worm thread" in the dark at one point when Frodo glanced down into the [[Morgul Vale]] from high above on the Stairs of Cirith Ungol.<ref name=stairs/>

==Other versions of the legendarium==
In ''[[The Book of Lost Tales]]'', [[Beleg]] is said to have thought of '''glowworms''' when seeing the bright light of [[Noldor|Noldo]] crystal lanterns.<ref>{{LT2|II}}, p. 78</ref> Glowworms also dwelt about the dark borders of the deep pools of [[Lórien (Valinor)|Murmuran]].<ref>{{LT1|III}}, p. 74</ref>

'''[[Great glow-worms]]''' often lurked around the borders of [[Olórë Mallë]], the Path of Dreams.<ref>{{LT1|I}}, p. 18</ref> As these creatures are mentioned only fleetingly, it is impossible to say if they were related to the great [[Worms]] (wingless [[Dragons]]), or if they were giant versions of regular glowworms. One can assume that they glowed in the dark (and therefore perhaps were related to, or were another name for, the [[spark-dragons]]).

==Other writings==
Some glow-worms were seen glowing around the turn of "the crooked fairy lane" in the poem ''[[Goblin Feet]]''.<ref>G.D.H. Cole and T.W. Earp, ''[[Oxford Poetry|Oxford Poetry 1915]]'', pp. 64-5</ref><ref>{{CP|27}}</ref> [[Wayne G. Hammond]] and [[Christina Scull]] mentioned on their website that glow-worms are "a form of beetle" in relation to their appearance in ''Goblin Feet''.<ref> {{webcite|author=[[Wayne G. Hammond]] & [[Christina Scull]]|articleurl=https://www.hammondandscull.com/addenda/collected_poems.html|articlename=Addenda and Corrigenda to The Collected Poems of J.R.R. Tolkien (2024)|dated=|website=HS|accessed=25 December 2025}}, entry for "p. 1436"</ref>
